comments.author: Ms2ger@gmail.com
comments.creator: Ms2ger@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: As mentioned in bug 650720 comment 9, we're alone in supporting BMP for canvas.toDataURL, and I assume we support a lot more than other formats. I'm not sure that's a good idea, and we should probably only expose PNG and JPEG to the public web.
comments.text: As mentioned in bug 650720 comment 9, we're alone in supporting BMP for canvas.toDataURL, and I assume we support a lot more than other formats. I'm not sure that's a good idea, and we should probably only expose PNG and JPEG to the public web.
I'm not convinced that we shouldn't support whatever we have encoders for.  The spec is designed to allow this kind of thing ...
comments.raw_text: I'm not convinced that we shouldn't support whatever we have encoders for.  The spec is designed to allow this kind of thing ...
comments.author: khuey@kylehuey.com
comments.creator: khuey@kylehuey.com

comments.author: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
comments.creator: VYV03354@nifty.ne.jp
comments.text: IMO we shouldn't support image/bmp with alpha unless there is a definitive answer whether the alpha is premultiplied or not.
comments.raw_text: IMO we shouldn't support image/bmp with alpha unless there is a definitive answer whether the alpha is premultiplied or not.
